instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after changing <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>
threads.message: Hi i have a water damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in with back right usb not working but everthing else ok , it had water damage around <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> so changed it and now usb working , i did knock off L3200 next to it but put it back on, before i started i did have a display and now i dont :-( , i have display on external monitor , i did notice some corrosion around <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> with pin 9 looking bad, guess my question is where to start troubleshooting no image on one of these, do i need screen connected or not ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after changing <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>
threads.message:
When you diagnose internal image problems, LCD must be always connected.
The internal eDP output is not enabled, if PCH doesn't recognize the LCD.
Resolder <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> and rebuild traces, if needed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after changing <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>
threads.message: Hi finally got hold of some <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> chips, changed it but also <RESISTOR>R8445</RESISTOR> blown , now have an image , many thanks
